title: Understanding ASD
text: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) is a developmental disorder that affects communication and behavior. It is called a 'spectrum' disorder because there is a wide variation in the type and severity of symptoms people experience.

title: Key Characteristics of ASD
text: ASD is characterized by challenges with social skills, repetitive behaviors, speech, and nonverbal communication. It also includes unique strengths and differences.

hintAnswer: (1) difficulty with communication and interaction with other people, (2) restricted interests and repetitive behaviors, and (3) symptoms that hurt the person’s ability to function properly in school, work, and other areas of life
title: Identifying Symptoms of ASD
text: Which of the following are symptoms of ASD?
choices: (1) difficulty with communication and interaction with other people, (2) restricted interests and repetitive behaviors, and (3) symptoms that hurt the person’s ability to function properly in school, work, and other areas of life
(1) difficulty with communication and interaction with other people, (2) restricted interests and repetitive behaviors

(1) difficulty with communication and interaction with other people, (2) restricted interests and repetitive behaviors, (3) compulsion to wash hands, check electronics, and live by $$self-imposed$$ rules
